New Records: Quinton de Kock finished with 65 as he smacked the tournament's joint-fastest half-century off 22 balls
Key Match Events: Kagiso Rabada and Anrich Nortje dismissed Harry Brook and Liam Livingstone in the last three overs
Quinton de Kock dominated South Africa's powerplay and had them motoring along at 63-0
Shai Hope hit 82 from 39 balls as the West Indies beat the United States by nine wickets
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa's win streak was extended to six games and it is a firm favorite for the semifinals after two wins in two matches in its group
Post-Match Reflections: Aiden Markram said 'Getting to those last three overs, the odds looked heavily against you, but the bowlers came back, it shows a lot of skill and shows the fight inside'
Jones said 'A tough night for the boys, against the West Indies we needed a target of 175 or 180 and obviously we didn't get that'
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa's win over England was its first loss in the Super Eight after it beat the West Indies by eight wickets at the same venue
Shai Hope was added to the West Indies' lineup for Friday's match as an injury replacement for Brandon King who was ruled out with a side strain
Others: Roston Chase took a career-best 3-19 and Andre Russell 3-31 as the West Indies limited the United States to 128 in 19.5 overs
